title: Is it a red flag that the man I am dating won't speak to me over an NFL game?
body:
Context on our situation:

We are in our late 20s. We are in the beginning stages of dating; ~4 months in. Haven't officially discussed exclusivity, but for the sake of discussion and simplicity let's say we are steadily approaching that level. However... still in that fragile getting to know each other's strengths and flaws stage. This is also long distance; that could be an important fact.


Details of my questions:

Our teams are HUGE rivals. Whenever they play each other we both talk shit; it's a lot of fun, and we love to talk about how "taboo" we are. Anyway, his team lost to mine last night, AT their home field, in the playoffs. I did NOT rub it in because as much as I love football, he cares way more than I do. In fact, I didn't text a single thing to him during or post game. I respect him enough to not be a douche bag about it. 


However now he won't talk to me. He literally told me he won't, and he is following through. At first I considered it a continuation of our running "sleeping with the enemy" joke, but he's taken it to a new level with punishing me for a football game... I feel ridiculous even verbalizing that this is an issue, but should I consider it a red flag in his behavior? I have no idea when he will text/call me again. He's effectively ruined my enjoyment of my teams victory by acting like a sore, salty-ass loser and I'm afraid that if I were to eventually be in a relationship with this person, this pouty behavior would be too common and cause problems. Do I tell him now that he is making me feel sad that now I can't even talk to the one person I want to? Or do I wait for him to finish licking his wounds?


On the other hand, am I thinking too much about it? I am prone to that, which is why I bring this question to the collective here. Thanks if you read this, I appreciate any feedback.

title: How do you rebuild self-discipline from scratch?
body:
The past few years I've allowed my self-discipline to erode away completely because I was depressed and trying (And failing) to get things done was exacerbating a some of my symptoms. However, now that I'm getting better the inability to self-motivate / generally get things done is impeding my recovery. 

I am trying to get assessed for ADHD which I believe may be a factor but it's tough to do that where I am so I'm hoping y'all might be able to suggest things I can do in the meantime to help.

title: How did you deal with losing your father at a young age?
body: I miss my dad a lot and today is a tougher one for me in particular. It’s been over two years but I still think about him constantly and it doesn’t take a lot for me to just break down and cry. Does “normal” ever come back? This place I’m in feels endless.... I miss having a masculine figure in my life to turn to for advice

title: Disability, anxiety, and dating/hookups. May I have some advice on all fronts, no matter how much you can/can't relate please?
body:
Sorry! This post ended up being much longer than I expected, but I feel like it's all pretty important because I still have these issues/thoughts about anyone and everyone else that I'm interested in. And a lot of this sounds like you have to explain it to me like I'm a five year old, and I'd honestly prefer it if you did. I'll always be willing to look dumb in the pursuit of improvement. I'm hoping that this is just a unique enough situation to warrant this post not violating rule 4.

I'm a 26 year old physically disabled guy. I have a muscular condition, which is essentially like ALS, but not AS severe in my case. Because I've been shy and anxious ever since I can remember, I never really got "broken out of my shell". On Tinder I've switched up the way I interact with women. In essence, I do my best to entirely ignore my anxiety and just go balls to the wall with my personality and I say things that are completely fine (likely) to say, but if I listened to my anxiety, I would never. It's working out pretty well! Fake it til you make it style.

However, at the end of the day, I still do have anxiety, and I'm even more inexperienced than you can imagine. For example, I'm not physically strong enough to do the five knuckle shuffle myself, so nudes don't really do much for me. I mean. They do, but I can't do anything about it which has led me to basically look at nudes through an artistic appreciation lens if that makes any sense. Anxiety, the no 5 knuckle shuffle, and the inexperience make me absolutely fucking awful at dirty talk. (How do you all know what they want to hear during impromptu dirty talk that you initiate?) So! I of course second guess myself a lot. Some of these questions might have painfully obvious answers, but, again, anxiety. And others aren't as obvious, but I would love to hear people's thoughts.

I know that I don't look all that attractive physically to most, but I don't even care about that, because if just my looks are a deal breaker, then I consider that a dodged bullet for sure. A lot of my charm is my jokes and me being smooth. I do super well over text, but thinking about saying certain stuff in person with my limitations doesn't sound very smooth. For example, I've been talking to a girl on Tinder for a few weeks and I've told her that given the opportunity, I would love to "tap that ass into orbit". That was also pretty early on, she's still seemingly interested, and she lives about 40 miles away. She plans on coming here to hang out soon. Tonight I asked her to send me a wet hair selfie after her shower because "wet hair selfies make my knees go weak". Smooth, right? She sent me a selfie where you can tell that she meticulously showed more than she "had" to, but covered her nipple with her hair. I called her out in a joking/teasing way and she all but said that she was teasing me.

She's a super cool person. Super adventurous type. I asked her if she wanted to see a movie, get dinner, chill at my place or tie a skateboard to the back of my chair and cruise around Walmart and she goes "Why not all of the above?" which gave me a raging heart-on. She's a goofball like I am.

Now. Here's where my mental block is. Being funny and smooth is my best moves besides manufactured confidence. Because of my disability, I can't really move much. So I can't really initiate anything in the most traditional ways. I have to use my words. "Hey wanna fuck?" or "let me kiss you" just doesn't...sound smooth or charming when I imagine it. Am I just too into my own head about it? Or, preferably, can you guys think of any more in character (funny/witty) ways to ask?

That's the difficult one. I seem to be doing well at knowing when someone is interested and is/or flirting. But if you guys have any thoughts on what I should look for in that area too, that would be super appreciated! Even if you feel like it's blatantly obvious, please do share still. Because besides the fake it til you make it part, I sincerely don't have any fucking clue what I'm doing even if it seems like I do. On her Tinder bio she said that she wasn't looking for anything serious, but she also deleted her account too. So even if someone isn't looking for something serious, they have the potential to find it anyway.

Probably another very obvious answer, but I want to make sure from people who are far more experienced than myself. I early on mentioned tapping that ass into orbit, her profile originally said nothing serious, she sent me flirty photos, and she's going to drive 40 miles to hang out with me. Is it pretty safe to assume that she's down to have her ass tapped into orbit? That distance sucks, but I'm also definitely capable of getting to her as well.

And just advice in general in this area would be fantastic. How to pick up girls in general. Honestly anything you can think of. Pretend I'm your son and you're teaching me how to ride a bike that I didn't even know existed.

Again, I apologize for the lengthy post! I've wondered about a lot of this for a LONG time.

title: What are some things that your wife/partner does to make you feel like a priority after you've had kids?
body:
Me(30F) and my partner(36M) have been together for the better part of the last 7 years and we have a 5 year old son together. 

Since the end of September he's been living at his moms an hour away because I couldn't handle him being in our house anymore. He had become so negative, lazy, undependable and started undermining me every chance he got when it came to parenting. I was so sure I was done with the relationship as he seemed unwilling to try to talk and attempt to work through our problems even though he kept saying he didn't want to break up. 

Well we got into a big fight in the beginning of this month and he finally opened up to me (which I know is really hard for him to do) and he told me that he's been feeling resentful towards me for a long time. He feels as though once I became a mom, I stopped being his partner. That I put all of myself into our son and our home and I don't leave anything left for him. That our relationship has become me telling him what to do and treating him more like an employee than my partner. 

I feel like such an arsehole. Since he told me that, it's all I can see. I was 24 when I got pregnant and once I had our son I knew I had to grow up so I kind of faked it until you make it kind of thing. It's like I hyper focused on being a mom and nothing else and of course having a kid makes it very hard to get any alone time so I must have just let our relationship fade into the background. 

I love this man with every part of me and I have since the moment I laid eyes on him and honestly I never intended for things to go this way so  I'm looking for any advice on ways I can make him feel like/show him I care about him and that our relationship is important to me. Or behaviors I should be changing, traditions/habits I could start so he knows I prioritize him (example could be making his favorite meal every whatever day of the month, so even if that day is a day that I'm exhausted, he knows that I still made it because I love him) 

I've only been able to think of things from a womans perspective so I'm hoping some of you can tell me what you would like as a man or what has your SO done to make you feel like a priority. I know what I'm asking may sound confusing but hopefully you can understand it enough Haha 

Please keep in mind that he's a recovering alcoholic so nothing to do with drinking or going out to a bar ect. We've also never hired a babysitter or left our son with family so that we could have time to ourselves but I would be willing to do so if you think it would help.

title: Is it better to go off on fake friends or no? Why or why not?
body:
I am almost 25 and I still struggle with anger issues and trust issues. I had a fallout with some close friends and it made me distrust everyone that was close to me. As a result, I hadn’t had a single relationship last long in the past few years. It makes me think there is something wrong with me as I always used to have friends. 

I resorted to friends after college who rarely would hit me up to chill. I’d always have to hit them up. Eventually I got booted from the group due to beef with some members. I got into a tussle with a guy for play and ended up getting hurt. I told him and he just made it seem like I was overreacting.  After that I distrusted the whole group. 

I ended up not keeping in touch with the group much recently. I had some close childhood friends in that group, but they’d rather chill with them than me nowadays. As soon as I sensed this, I developed some hate towards my former friends.

Nowadays, I get drunk and try and solve issues through text with friends. It has made me create a toxic relationship towards friends. Now I’m willing to call out friends for their fake ness as soon as shit hit the fan. I’m tired of fake friends and I’m aggressively trying to lose them.

I don’t know if this is good or not. I can tell when a friend eventually turns into an acquaintance because they’d rather chill with new people and not bother keeping in touch with me. And it’s not always their fault I guess, sometimes they are so busy to reply.

But it always hits me personally. So I end up drinking a lot one night, and venting my concerned about the relationship to all these friends. But they look at me like I’m crazy and gives them more of a reason to avoid me. For instance, my friend went on a trip this past weekend, they didn’t even mention it to me. They had planned it behind my back and they didn’t even care enough to include me. I don’t even like to call them my friends because I know deep down they don’t care.

 The thing is that the one guy who I’m closest with, hits me up when it’s convenient for him. But he doesn’t hit me up otherwise unless I remind him. He even told me he was busy last weekend, he posts on his story chilling with a friend and his gf. But he tells me he couldn’t chill, which just makes me have trust issues. The truth is that I can’t connect with them without weed or beer so it makes me think of I’m truly their friends.

title: What is saddest thing in your life?
body: Im in realy shitty situation but my gf want help me but she can't do single thing and she can just watch how is it worse and worse.All my friend's that I had before are now against me and nobody can't help me out of it.

title: Men whose SO has mental health issues. How does this effect the way you feel about him/her?
body:
My depression seems to be incurable. Anti depressants helped for a bit but then made me worse, therapy helped a little, and exercising was just another thing for me to become obsessed with. I have good and bad days but even on a good day I can flip and start bashing my head against the wall or try to put a carrier bag over my head. 

I really don't feel like he loves me anymore. He shows me a bit but we both work long hours and don't see each other much and  he takes gaming quite seriously. We used to sometimes play together but that doesn't happen anymore. I tried to watch the walking dead with him but it upset me too much. I know it's ridiculous and I really enjoyed it when I watched it before but I'm not in the right place mentally for it anymore! My SO is very comfortable financially, VERY attractive (people often comment he looks like a male model) and working on a PhD. He could be with anyone. 

So I'm interested to know why men in particular stay with their partners even when the going gets tough.

title: How common is stress ED?
body: I've been under a ton of stress and the pinaccle of it happened on sunday... well for the past 4 days I haven't been able to get a hard on. It's starting to scare me. I went from jerkin it twice a day to no sex drive what so ever. I don't have anyone to ask about it and if I did I sure as shit wouldn't tell them about it. It's kinda scary going from high sex drive to none.

title: How do you handle fear when its something about your health?
body:
I lose my health insurance next month because I'm turning 26. Im working overtime to find a job with health benefits and despite my having 3 degrees, im not having any luck. Im a chronic pain patient with a serious connective tissue disorder called Loeys-Dietz so im on a lot of meds that I need in order to survive Orland not be in crippling pain but I won't be able to get them after I lose my health insurance. 

Im scared out of my mind. Ive been having panic attacks for the last week. Despite everything I've been through, I've never been scared but now, im frequently breaking down and crying (thank God I live alone except for my dog) because im absolutely terrified about whats going to happen once I lose my health insurance.

I've tried everything I can think of but fear wins every time and im losing hope...

title: How do I get over a girl that played me that I cannot ignore.
body:
Hers the context, I am 21 a nursing student, I have this girl that played me last semester, so this girl showed signs that she likes me, she always initiates conversation, shes flirty and she express innuendos also, and we didnt got close that much due to my social anxiety towards her and her friends, I kinda dont vibe with her friends even though they are trying to befriend me, so yeah one day she asked ke directly, do I have a gf, and when I said I dont have one she said why, and after that while talking to her friends, her friend said that she said I am handsome so I went to have a conversation with them, they are befriending me but I am shy and not really good socially so we end up not being that close.

After that I got afraid that I might lose her and she has feelings for me, well from what I know she is single so you know what, I got drunk ans confessed on her, well in front of my class groupchat and everybody knows, after that everyone are teasing us, she never replied if I had a chance but she just kept on flirting, and before the end of classes, she gave me this hope that I had a chance, and then the last day of class, she walked out with her boyfriend like she deliberatley trying to hurt me, I cried going home that day pissed of to her but especially to me, I blame myself for not being good enough, I tried to use that to motivate myself to improve myself more and that if I dont someone will take what I should've have but yeah it is still hard.

Now I found out our class got reshuffled, and I am with the same class again with her, well she is kinda nice and flirty still I guess, because I drunk texted 2x after that incident and still expressing in a joking way how much I love her in our GC, mayeb she got turned off of my vices and the people I hangout with and me slacking off on my grades but what she did is bullshit, but I just feel shit and feel like a loser that I am not enough thats why she didnt picked me, and today I saw her, we didnt spoke, but seeing her smiling and being happy after that just fucks me up because I am just still into her and I cannot avoid her, I went home way to early and miss a class because I cannot do it, I went home with teary eyes, and anger that I need to stop being a lazy fuck and focus on improving my health looks and other aspects of my life so that shot will not happen again which is caused by my low self esteem, idk man I still love her and feel hurt when I see her but I cannot ignore her.

title: Realized I might be seen as a "crazy girl". Serious question, what do define as a crazy girl/what types or levels are there?
body:
I am not violent, I don't stalk or get jealous or make demands (often I am encouraged to ask for help/assistance more because I can be overly Independent and always prefer to help others), I don't cheat or steal, have no psychological disorders and am often told I am one of the sweetest people someone's ever met-so no forms of cruelty either.

But....

I do have a history of depression (it's better now and only situational), I tried to commit suicide when I was a teenager, but am also told my ability to remain hopeful and optimistic when things are tough is great. I also tend to say what is on my mind, have a dark/dr. House sense of humor, my father who I was extremely close with died from his alcohol and drug addiction addiction when I was 20. I've moved around and traveled a lot, was abused as a child, not an alcoholic but I come form a family of alcoholics and I can definitely party-no hard drugs though, am a former self harmer but recently had a relapse, I don't causally sleep with people but once I am comfortable enough to sleep with I am up for anything, am very enthusiastic and particularly enjoy oral. Also, I am a bisexual, which I am putting in my post because it seems to make some people assume it's a crazy/damaged quality.

And I certainly don't tell someone this right up front but if we've known each other for a couple of month, you'll mostly likely know all this.

And all of those quality seem to be attached to the label of the "crazy" or "damaged" girl.

1) Based on the qualities I have, would I be seen as a crazy girl? Or a damaged girl?

2) Are there levels of crazy/damaged to you?
 
3) What are they and are their any you would date?

title: It's been two months, so why don't I feel any better?
body:
About two months ago, my nearly six-year-long relationship ended. It was ugly and it was painful. But I'm doing it right. No contact. New apartment. 4 weeks into SL 5x5 and kicking ass. Got a new job, enrolled in 17 hours of classes this semester, expanding my social circles, reconnecting with old friends, breaking shitty old habits, and adopting a slew of good new ones. By any standard, I'm doing great.


Except I can't really get her off my mind. I stay busy. I read, I write, I hang out with people. But in the moments during the page turn, or the clicking of the mechanical pencil, or the lull in conversation during dinner, there she is. She's there after I turn off the light, there in my dreams, and I wake up in a panic wondering where I am and where she is. Literally every damn day.


Every victory of the last two months (and I'm indescribably proud of how many there have been) is punctuated by how proud I think she'd be. I'm trying not to dwell. I'm not dwelling, really. I'm being ambushed, and the weeks since have done nothing to decrease the sense of loss.


I know I'm brokenhearted. I've been here before. But it doesn't seem to be getting better. What do?

EDIT: I need to put my head down, stay the course, and do the hard, painful work while everything hurts anyway.

I just have this sense of yet more lost time to go. I want so badly to move on with my life. The last several months of the relationship itself were so goddamn destructive and pointless, I really hate the idea of being held back still in such a fundamental way.

The past can be such a morass of regret and misery that I try to avoid considering it more than is necessary. I think what I'm so bothered by is that intellectually, I've got this thing figured out. What happened, what to do now, and whenever the time comes, a pretty solid idea of what and what not to do next time around.

The entire emotional experience is beyond my conscious control. That's cool too. That shit is basic, primitive, built into the hardware itself. Different juices squirt around in my brain and I feel different things before I've had the opportunity to even apply anything cognitive to it.

Its always a choice, and I've been choosing well. The more a habit I make of it, the better position I'll be in and habits I'll have when I finally pull my head out of my ass and stop living so mechanically. Thanks for helping me realize that I'm okay. I'm doing better than well, even if it doesn't feel like it.

title: How should one take revenge?
body:
Fed up. Fed up of being single. Fed up of being used. Fed up of the hardships of life that never seem to end. Fed up of being broke and poor, always struggling to get by. Fed up of constantly seeing others get what I want but never reaching it myself. I'm done being patient, done waiting for things to change. It’s time to rise up and take revenge on the circumstances that have held me back. No more playing small. 

Help me !

title: How big of a priority is your girlfriend in your life?
body:
Basically, I’ve been dating my girlfriend a few months and due to recent events, I’m basically freaking out. It’s like moving too fast for me even though it’s logically not moving that fast and the relationship, along with me going back to school while working full time, is pretty much causing anxiety for me because I feel like I can’t afford to fuck up school or work anymore (getting older, finally know what I want to do, etc) 

I talked to her about all this and she’s obviously upset. We even planned a trip across the country to visit her family and hang out that I’m just starting to lose it. It’s a lot for me and with my other priorities, I’m just getting very stressed out. I told her she should still try to go with a friend instead of with me and that didn’t help things and I’m pretty sure she’s just like “fuck him” which I don’t really blame her for doing given my own reservations about all this. 

I could use some bro talk or something here because I feel like I’m about to lose my first good relationship because I only just started trying to get my life together which is taking more priority in my head.

title: How did you correctly mourn for the loss of a loved one?
body: I’m asking because I lost my best friend last night and I don’t know what to do. I keep on trying to make myself more positive but once I remind myself I end up being depressed. I lost my appetite and don’t want to eat anything at all. I regret not doing a lot of things with him and I regret that we didn’t talk as much as we should have.

title: Guys who have cheated — how did you get over the other woman?
body: For those out there who have cheated on their SO, how did you get over the person you cheated with?  I spent the first week after a drunken event feeling so shitty about myself, I honestly thought that I would never be happy again.  My regret knew no limit.  I felt I had completely ruined my life. I had betrayed my SO, my family, her family, and all the ideals I had lived up to for my entire life.   Imagine my surprise when my mind suddenly flipped from remorse to longing for another chance with “her.”  I know that it won’t happen.  I know that it CAN’T happen.  But my brain keeps thinking of it as something desirable and possible.  And to make matters worse, she is sending me messages encouraging it.  How do I get rid of this feeling?  I’m sure the ‘right’ answer is to cut her out of my life completely, but I don’t even know if that is possible.  I’d love to hear from other dudes who have had similar experiences (if there are any).  Thanks.

title: Honestly down on all of my cards. What do you do when you have nothing left? Have you ever been in a situation where it all seemed to be going downhill? What can I do at this point?
body:
So a little about myself. I'm 23(M) and for as Long as I can remember I've always been fucking shit up. I'm just not always there. I get distracted so easy, lack serious case of moativations unless I'm backed against the wall, and I'm lazy.

I've been living in the city at a sublet for 7 months now. I don't speak to my mom or immediate family because it was a very toxic environment when I was growing up. I've been abandoned, kicked out, and even just packed my shit and dipped. (This all started when I was 16)

Now my backs really against the wall. I picked up a habit of smoking. And tbh I liked it. Weed just helped me. Helped me through alot. But I can't ignore the fact That through and through its been the catalyst for each and every one of my major falls.

Fast forward to last night. I had just enough left to roll a small J. I went outside to smoke. (Won't smoke in the house. The lady who I sublet the room from does not like any of that) Came back with the munchies and popped an instant ramen into the microwave. Here's stupid me. I forgot to add water.

After 5 minutes I go back to the kitchen only to smell smoke. And it's everywhere. I'm lucky there wasn't a fire tbh. Immediately I open all the windows in the house. Settled the smoke, and then I started to clean everything.

This was at 3:00am so I left a note detailing what happened and that I accept full responsibility. 

I left for work and came back where my sublet tells me that she's sorry but she needs me to move out in a week. I understand tbh.

Here's the kicker. Because of the holidays I was down off work for 2 weeks. So I had to tap into my savings just to pay rent. Now savings is exhausted. 

I've got no family lifelines to call and ask for a place to crash. I've been honestly contemplating just ending it. I'm tired. I have no more energy for this. Everytime I ask myself if I see myself in 2020 my body just seize up. I'm not crying, I'm not in intense emotional distress. I feel nothing. Honestly trying to see if there's a way for me to off myself, but can't do deal with the thought of putting past family and loved ones through that.

TLDR: Getting kicked out in a week from my sublet. Holidays exhausted my funds. No family to go back to. Trying to rationalize ending it.

title: How to gain confidence and not be a pushover as an overanalytical introvert?
body:
**Background:** 6 ft 165 lbs so unfortunately not a huge guy. I have always been an introvert & shy since I was little. Was a nerd growing up and didn't have many friends. I tend to shy away from confrontations and look for an alternate solution. I also took a personality test that identified me as an INTJ which explains a lot. I've been very successful in my career and that has given me somewhat of a boost in confidence.  I goto the gym and lift weights 4-5 times a week.

**My problem:** I've been getting more and more depressed when I back down from situations where I should be making my voice be heard. When something happens that is bothering me, instead of speaking up I overanalylyze & rationalize my concern instead of telling the person what's on my mind. Then I get home and beat myself up over it.

**Example**
Was on the patio of a restaurant and these 2 guys were smoking and the wind was blowing the smoke into my face. Instead of telling them hey can you please move further away, I freeze up and rationalized it as well there wasn't a non smoking sign and I was almost done eating anyways to avoid confrontation.

Every time this happens, I spiral into depression for a day or two. I would like to break out of this cycle and was wondering if anyone has any advice on this matter?

title: Men, if you're romantically interested in someone, when would you want to know about any past trauma they've had?
body:
Here's a little about me. When I was 7 or 8 I was sexually abused multiple times by two different family members. As a result, I've never been able to form a serious relationship and have intimacy issues. I've never told anyone about this. Before some of you tell me to seek professional help, I have considered going to see a therapist but I don't have the money or time right now. 

Anyways, I'm in my early 20's and finally like who I am and feel good about myself. I've tried online dating and have had an overall okay experience. My problem is that every time I feel like something good could happen, I tend to push people away or shut down. I just don't know when to tell someone I'd like to date about this. I guess I'm afraid of what they'll think of me, or that they won't be interested anymore. I know, those aren't the guys worth my time anyway.

I don't want to miss out on someone I see potential with anymore. Men, please help!

title: What do you do if you feel like can't keep up in life anymore?
body: I'm about to lose my job and it seems so hard to find a new one. I lost my last money last night.

title: For those that have been cheated on, how did you cope mentally?
body: I cant help but take it extremely personally and just feel inferior to the guy that she cheated on me with. I internalize it and its super unhealthy. Advice? The waves of depression and memories that hit me are overwhelming. So much resentment, sadness, bitterness, etc for being led on and lied to and having her fuck this guy behind my back for FIVE fucking months.

title: [Over 40 Men] How do I date again if I have no friends, no family and I am starved for affection.
body:
Dear Over 40 men,
   I am a 41 year old man.  Wealthy.  Successful.  Not fat or ugly.  I can get laid fairly easily, but that is not what I want.  I want a healthy relationship with a caring, nurturing, sexual woman.  Looks aren't even a big deal for me.  Just attitude.  My ex was very mentally and at times physically abusive.  She isolated me from my friends (have no friends now) and I have no family.  We met when I was twenty.  She was my third sexual experience (still didn't know what to do really) and my second relationship of any type.  

I met someone online, and I promptly messed that up.  Probably because I am so starved for affection.  I wrote a TIFU about it.  I can't link it, but you can find it in my profile.


My question to you guys is, if I need nurturing and care in order to heal and be able to stop being so emotionally starved, but I scare anyone that is capable or willing to give me this care with my desperate need, how do I get out of this catch 22?

How do I start to live again?  Or did those twenty years in a bad relationship ruin me for anyone?

PS:  That's probably the most pathetic thing I've ever written, but sadly true.

title: I just realized I have absolutely nothing to lose...now what?
body: I made a post about doing fun free things a while ago, but that got me thinking. Long story short, I'm poor, on the verge of homelessness, have no relationships weighing me down, and really have no desire to live like this anymore. I hate where I live, it's expensive as hell, and I am just sick of working as a slave to barely make it by. So...put yourself in my shoes. What do you do? Just remember the only restraints you have are budgetary.

title: What should you do if you really have no motivation to do anything?
body: I already take meds, therapy, I go to gym. I just don't enjoy anything no matter how. Therefore, I have no motivation to do anything that I don't need to survive, because why?

title: How did you overcome your porn/masterbation addiction?
body:
Hey guys,

I'm on a journey of self improvement and one thing that I'm not proud of is my constant sexualization of women. I've been an avid porn user since I was about 11 years old (29 now) and usually jerk 5 to 7 times a week. I'm happy to have a high sex drive but I'm aware this quick dopamine hit is affecting my ability to interact with women I find attractive to the point I'm embarrassed.

Note: I know porn addiction is a relatively newly studied phenomenon and some of you will say its not a thing. Hey, that's great, I'm really happy some people are able to enjoy the content without being mentally effected. Unfortunately I have addiction issues and I don't work like that.

I've been able to overcome many, many addictions but porn has been the one that I can't seem to. I tried SAA, etc. I tend to always relapse. Counselling is not helping either.

I'm trying to find a medium: I want to reset my dopamine and my brain in a sense - I want to feel confident speaking to attractive women (I already gym, improved my fashion, all the stuff that most people suggest) without doing it for the sole purpose of fantasizing/hoping to get laid/being a nervous wreck. but I would ALSO like to be able to release myself. Its been 2 weeks and I'm losing my mind. Unfortunately, I don't think I have that option right now as it very quickly leads to a "relapse". Even if I finishing without porn, I end going back to it.

Anybody here have experience with this? Tips? Words of encouragement?

title: How do you adjust from being cared about before 16 to no one truly having you're back
body: I'm now in my early 20s. I've realised no one is going save me and that's okay but how do I migrate the feelings of despair and loneliness into a positive outlook?

title: How did you manage to control your fears?
body:
Not trying to be negative nancy. Just wanting to know what I can do about it.

I have a problem of allowing my fear to control me, than the other way around, by using it as motivation. I have social anxiety (pretty bad), and severe depression. I feel that's what's wrong with me.

I just have no idea how to break free from that prison.

So, in total, I just wonder how you guys managed to control the fear of anything to being able to feel normal.

title: How do you deal with Erectile Dysfunction at a young age?
body: My girlfriend and I found out she was pregnant in the middle of July. We’ve always had an amazing sex life and I’ve never had any issues maintaining an erection when with her. Recently she went to the beach on vacation for 5 days. While she was gone I masturbated a lot and stressed out about stuff at home involving her and her pregnancy, our apartment, etc. The first night she got back, I couldn’t get an erection. Since then, we’ve had sex a few times and about half the time I can’t get hard or hold the erection. I keep thinking back to that first night with problems. Am I screwed and is this the future of our relationship?? Should I talk to a mental health professional? I’m really freaking out. Thanks for any advice.

title: Why can't I find my masculinity?
body:
Hi, I am a 39-year-old man and I feel I am still struggling to connect to my masculinity. Like most men, when I was young I wanted to grow up to become a strong man. However, throughout my life, I haven't really felt this. 

My early life was difficult. My father was an alcoholic and emotionally abusive who left us when I was around 6-7 years old. He is also probably the most masculine man I have ever met (even though it's clear he has his flaws). There was no denying he was the alpha. I still have a relationship with him but only see him a few times a year.

Then, on the other hand, I was raised mostly by my over-protective and fearful mother with my 2 sisters. I had very little male influence in my life growing up. Except for my uncle who came into my life as I was around 9 years old. But he was also toxic and developed an unhealthy relationship with my older sister. He would also have crazy outbursts of anger. So I have aways grown up quite fearful of men and people in general. 

When I was young I was very shy and quiet but I managed to get through school pretty much unscathed by laying low and in my teenage years by putting on a tough guy persona even though inside I was a scared pussy. I was scared of the dark until I was into my 20's. But I understood that by acting tough most people wouldn't mess with me. When I got into my later teens I would hang around with groups who were destructive and violent and I did some stuff I am not proud of. This was until I was 21 when I messed with the wrong group and it scared me so much I withdrew completely from violence and fighting. 

It was about this time I started to lift weights and started to build myself up. I thought being big and jacked would make me a man. I spent about 10 years lifting and getting big but I still didn't connect to that sense of masculinity I have been seeking my whole life. Most of my life I have been promiscuous with women but have always struggled to attract high-value women. Over the last few years, I have even started to question my sexuality even though I have never found men sexually attractive. This has also caused me a lot of distress.

I do also struggle to connect with other men. I can get along fine with 'beta' males. But anytime I am around a strong alpha male, I just feel fearful and struggle to be myself. I have linked this back to my early life experiences but also because I haven't been able to connect to the masculinity within myself. It's almost as though I am scared of my power and so I feel scared around other men who express their power.

On a positive note over the last 4-5 months, I have done a lot of good work on myself, I still enjoy working out but its more about the mental benefits for me now. I am quite disciplined in life and do activities that challenge me. So over these last few months, I have noticed a gradual improvement in my life. But I have come to realize that real change is slow. 

I do wonder if I will ever feel like a 'man' or if this sense of masculinity is even inherent within me? Or am I searching for something I will never find? Is my nature naturally more soft and feminine? Should I just accept this? Or is it a byproduct of overprotective mothering? 

I'm sure I am not the only one in this position. Just wondered if anyone had any advice. (My first time posting btw)

Thanks for reading

title: For those guys who really struggled... how do you bounce back?
body:
So I'm going to do my best to be precise here. I could go on for a while.

I'm 31 and I just recently lost another job in my professional tech career. Granted, I had a late start due to finishing college in my mid 20s so my experience is only a few years. However, here I am again being let go from another job. I'll be the first to admit perhaps I wasn't the best employee and I struggled with being consistently motivated. I honestly should've left the company a while ago because it was ultimately a dead-end. 

I'm starting to realize that maybe I'm too fucked up and my brain can't undo the wiring of who I am. I've always had a difficult time with school, deadlines, attendance, motivation, confidence, etc. Maybe if I had better guidance when I was younger instead of "just do what makes you happy" nonsense then I'd be in an ideal spot. Not only am I struggling career wise, but I'm nearly broke, drive a shitty car, never had a gf, and now I've been dealing with herniated disc for several months. 

My parents are worried about me and other family members act like I'm a leper. I don't want to say I'm suicidal but shit man when are things going to change for the better? I know life is suffering but it really does look like I'm a failure to launch. It seems like the longer someone goes on with constant disappointment and no compounding success, it just eventually consumes them. I want to become to the best version of myself but does that person even exists?

title: How do I stop feeling like a failure?
body: For the most part I’ve done great for an 18 year old kid. I have a lot of accomplishments I ought to be really proud of and to be honest many continually praise me for that, but the truth is, I constantly feel like a failure. Before I lied to myself that I didn’t know the cause but deep down I know what it is. All my life I’ve grown up watching these extraordinary men, these heroes, do incredible things both on and off the screen. All my life even though my father was present ive tried to build who I am based of the superman and Spider-Mans and famous celebrities of the world. Even though most of my personality is a direct result of my father subconsciously A part of me just wished that I also could be amazing. To have an extraordinary life with a wonderful adventure. To feel like my life is a journey with real weight that actively influences the hearts and minds of other people. I know I’ll never be some super hero or some crazy rich actor but somewhere inside my mind it won’t accept anything less than perfection anything less than a life with real meaning. I don’t even know where I was going with all this but, how do I convince myself that I don’t need powers or money to have life that means something. How do I convince myself that’s it’s okay to average that it’s not a curse. How I convince myself that I’m not a failure?

title: What should a woman do when a man won't leave her alone after she's rejected him multiple times?
body: Recently married, and a former guy friend turned nutcase won't leave me alone - begged me to have an affair/leave my husband. I say no, I'm staying with my husband, enough is enough. Then he guilt trips me after I go no contact (it works). I'm starting to get scared that he's going to do something crazy to me or my husband, so that's part of why I fail at going no contact. How do I get him to go away for good?

title: Dealing with "Sexual Assault" as a Man?
body:
Hi,

Throwaway, obviously. Recently I was given date rape drugs at a bar, and as a result ended up having sex with a very aggressive girl while completely gone. I have no memories of the event, just waking up afterwards. Obviously it wasn't forceful given that size difference etc, but it wasn't anything I would have consented to normally due to being in a relationship -- and, as a man, if any girl had been half as gone as I was then, I would never consider doing anything sexual with them. 

Since then, my girlfriend has broken up for me for "cheating" on her, and the general consensus among friends is either that I am a dick who just got wasted and cheated or that it's awesome that I had sex with an attractive girl. 

This has been sort of a shitty cycle, as personally I'm embarrassed/ashamed/uncomfortable about it. Gonna talk to a therapist about it, of course, but I'm curious if anyone else has been in a similar situation. It's tough for me to bring this up with people given that it doesn't really fit into traditional expectations of what sexual assault is, and I'm not even totally sure if that is the right way to describe it. Would just be nice to get perspectives since I don't really want to talk to people in person about this.

title: I feel like I'm stuck in a broken cycle of seeking dominance.
body: Some background, I go to a military college and I'm in ROTC... I feel like all my relations with other males are about asserting dominance and all that. I feel like I'm always under pressure to be assertive and alpha against other guys because I feel like they don't respect me. I know it's a bad way of looking at relations, but I can't stop it. I always have a compulsion to prevent other people from being "alpha" over me and sometimes I become hostile. Little snarky comments about me get me really pissed and I feel a need to retaliate, which does nothing for me in the long run. How can I learn to relax and be confident in my relationships with peers?

title: How do I stop being angry about my past all the time
body:
I’m an angry person. Like I don’t know how to explain it, but I always feel like I’m stuck in the past. I think of things that happened to me and I get mad all over again and I find that I start thinking violently and fantasizing about hurting those who wronged me.

I have an aunt who abused me pretty badly as a child. I think about it often and I get mad at my parents and at everyone for letting it happen. 

I had to go to counselling as a kid and as a teenager because I had explosive anger issues. I’ve been legitimately trying to get better for years but I feel like nothing is working and I’m always headed to some nervous breakdown. 

I just want to find peace

title: I just realized I might have unintentionally sexually harassed a friend many years ago. Read my story, tell me what you think of it, what you think I should do about it today and how I should handle the troubling feeling of guilt.
body: This is a longer story to read. Take it as proof that it is something that deeply troubles me, even though, after reading, some might come to the conclusion that I need not worry at all. The events I describe here happened about *18 years ago*. I can’t exactly pinpoint when it was from memory. It was roughly during the last year at school or the year after leaving highschool (or the equivalent of highschool in my country). Probably the former. I remember to have taken a riddled note of it in my diary at the time, but couldn’t find it in there. **Some exposition first** So, as young adults, me and my circle of friends (all 18-20 years old at the time) used to go to a club that was about a 30 minute drive away from where we lived. We went there almost every weekend, and a lot of times, one of our teachers from school, who we also casually hung out with sometimes on weekends, took us there in his car. If you think that’s weird, I agree, but I did not think much of it back then. And even though it’s not at the center of what I want to get off my chest in this post: behold, more on that later. One of those nights, we were there with four people, I think. Said Teacher, me, a male and a female friend. Not sure about the male friend though, maybe it was just the three of us. As usual, we partied, danced and got drunk. Somethin was different than usual. I recall the interaction with said female friend as being flirtatious that evening. It is noteworthy here that a couple of years before that we had a fling and she also was the first girl I dated and kissed, which is actually another not so cool story on its own. At the time of the events here, however, we were both in a relationship with someone else. I was in a relationship with another girl, who she was best friends with and who also was part of our social circle, yet not present that evening. She was in a relationship with another guy, and on occasion we would all hang out together. I didn’t have a crush on her or anything, but I definitely still found her very attractive, and she certainly was. She often was very flirtatious with men and had a lot of admirers / guys chasing her. I’m not saying she was a „slut“ or anything. That’s not what I mean here and that’s also not what I thought back then. What I mean is that she seemed to enjoy getting guys excited about her, or at least that is what I and some of my friends, including my girlfriend at the time, thought of her. She knew how to push the right buttons, so to say. At that time, there was also a persistent rumor that she had an affair with the teacher I mentioned, who was three times our age. It is something I never believed back then but found out many years later to be true. **How that evening went** What I know for a fact is, that evening I was getting very excited about her. I do not recall specific details as to why I felt that way, but just consider me a rather insecure 20 yo man, full of hormones and a little too much alcohol. I felt turned on by her. And I think that she was about as drunk as I was. Reflecting on it today, I have to admit it is entirely possible, that that’s what I made myself believe: that she somehow made me feel that way, that she sent signals. Maybe that was what I wanted to believe that night, wishful thinking. I don’t know. When we were on our way back, driving in the car late at night, the following happened. We were all drunk, tired and exhausted. She was in the passenger seat, and I was in the backseat, sitting behind her, while the teacher (sober, of course) was driving the car. I wanted to touch her and since I also was very insecure, I asked her if she would like me to massage her. She said yes, and so I started massaging her on the way home. We usually would not engage in such activities involving physical contact, that’s just not how we were with each other friendship-wise. It was a little step in another direction, and I had no clear goal in mind here, yet I slowly began to touch her in a more sexual way, slowly moving my hands under her shirt a little further, and further, ultimately carressing her breasts. Not in a will-nilly-let’s-go kind of way, but slowly, carefully exploring. Since I wouldn’t have wanted her to feel uncomfortable. This went on for a little while, I think. I was thinking she enjoyed it, even though it was obviously objectively hard to tell under the described circumstances. At some point I stopped and that’s it. Eventually the ride ended. Teacher dropped each of us off individually since we lived a little spread out in the area. I don’t remember who got off first and all that. So that was that. **Initial afterthoughts** I recall being very ashamed the next day. Ashamed, because I felt that with this whole thing I had cheated on my girlfriend that night (and that she had too). And in my mind, I blamed the girl for that (even though the physical thing, touching her, was clearly my own initiative). I felt like shit and swore I would never speak of this, never think about it again, and I think I just completely avoided that girl from that day on. Actually I have no memory about the times following these events. All I can say is that we never spoke about it and that over the years, everyone went different ways,...

title: How to stop thinking or caring about your ex?
body:
Ok. My soon-to-be ex wife and I have been virtually separated for but still under the same roof, both taking care of our child. We basically did the same stuff as we did when together except the sex stopped like a month ago. Shortly after that i guess she started talking to some dude and took a liking to him.

At first it didn’t bother me, but then her sister showed up and it just got worse for me. Im not trying to listen, but i can hear her talking about having sex with him and thats when it started bugging me. I mean come on, we cool but I’m not trying to hear that. They talking for s couple week or a month I think then last night, she heads to meet ol’ boy with her sister, a double date or something. (Left at about 8:30 pm)
She shares her location with me in case some shit go down.
4:30 am rolls around and her sister pops back at the house alone. She left her sister ALONE with some dude she practically just met at his house because she said “kick rocks” (ie: leave so i can get dicked down)
Part of me was worried cuz i mean come on we have a young child and if he tried some shit. They’re 60 miles away. I cant do shit.
By 5:40 she turns off her location, I’m starting to lose it. Because why turn it off? Its not like im constantly looking at it but yeah that happened.

So basically i sit up all night. She comes back at 8:30 am. I’m upset cuz I was freaking out. No call, no text in a 12 hour time frame? Im not trying to sound sexist but it is easier for women to get _taken advantage_ than men so of course I’m upset. A full half goes by and she finally says something to me and I just said nothing. I ignored her.
The very sound of her voice makes me want to Hulk out, even though we havent been together or even had sex in a while but it feels like she cheated. Ironic. I feel as though that closeness we did have has been annihilated by her relations with ol’ boy. I cant even look at her sister either with whom I’ve been neutral.

I don’t want her back but I think I’m envious or furious that she finally had sex with someone else after 5 years. Sounds selfish and very unbecoming of my character and I’d like some advice as how to get over it as soon as possible so Im at least able to look at her without feeling rage.

I feel like a kid asking but fuck it. Thank you for any _useful_ tips.

Sorry it was long winded but thought you should know the story.

title: What to look forward to after you have passed the prime of your life ?
body:
I guess I am dealing with midlife crisis.  I am in my mid 40s am now dealing with serious existential issues.  I can notice visible degradation in my physical looks. My remaining parent is sick and I am not looking forward to their mental and physical degradation.  I have already crossed my peak career earning at work.  The only thing I look forward to is to watch my kids grow up.  I have lost interest in almost every aspect of life.

What do you guys look forward to and how do you keep yourself motivated to keep moving on ?
